abstract: The conviction of James Treacy, former chief operating officer of Monster, was upheld, but his forfeiture amount will be lower.
snippet: The conviction of James Treacy, former chief operating officer of Monster, was upheld, but his forfeiture amount will be lower.
lead_paragraph: An appeals court upheld the conviction of James J. Treacy, the former chief operating officer of Monster Worldwide, for improperly accounting for backdated stock options, but it also ruled that the amount he had to forfeit was not correctly calculated.

headline.main: Appeals Court Cuts Forfeiture From Ex-Officer at Monster
headline.print_headline: Appeals Court Cuts Forfeiture From Ex-Officer at Monster
